description: The PRODIGE project, led by Sophie Nicklaus at INRAE, aims to enhance regional food systems by fostering public-private partnerships. It involves diverse stakeholders, including local governments, agricultural cooperatives, and citizens, to address food supply challenges and promote sustainable practices. The initiative emphasizes the role of research in quantifying impacts and facilitating discussions on compensation for affected parties, while navigating the complexities of local, regional, and national governance structures.
name: Sophie Nicklaus
